intro: Leucanthemum flosculosum, commonly known as the white leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, producing clusters of white to pale yellow petals surrounded by a ring of yellow-orange disk flowers. This species is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and natural landscapes.
